title: Start a WireMock Server in development mode

labels.name: area/quarkiverse
labels.description: This issue/PR is part of the Quarkiverse organization

body:
### Description

Run Wiremock (https://wiremock.org/) together with your Quarkus application in development mode.
Separated from your application code and only build when a property is set. 

While Wiremock can be easily started in a separate process, it is nice to have it together in one project with one startup command.
 
Interested in this extension, please +1 via the emoji/reaction feature of GitHub (top right).

### Configuration suggestion

quarkus.wiremock.dev.enabled=true
quarkus.wiremock.dev.path=src/main/resources

### Additional context

Currently within our team we use Wiremock for our integration tests. During development we also run a standalone Wiremock process where we can develop against. It would be nicer to run Wiremock embedded when development mode is active. The  lifecycle will be synced and you would only have to run quarkus:dev to get everything you need. 

While we need Wiremock in development we do not want this to be active in prod. 

I already did a POC where I could successfully point to a folder with all the Wiremock mappings.
[wiremock-dev.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/9229544/wiremock-dev.zip)

If there is interest I can iterate further on this.
